thread.title: What is a vote of no confidence? Theresa May clings on to power amid Brexit deal chaos

author: Michael Marsh
title: What is a vote of no confidence? Theresa May clings on to power amid Brexit deal chaos
text:
News What is a vote of no confidence? Theresa May clings on to power amid Brexit deal chaos Conservative MPs will hold a vote in the House of Commons to determine the fate of Theresa May's leadership Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily
Theresa May faces a battle to cling onto her job after a vote of no confidence was triggered.
Conservative MPs will hold an anonymous vote between 6pm and 8pm on Wednesday night.
Under the party's rules, a vote of no confidence is triggered when at least 15% of MPs - that means 48 currently - write a formal letter.
Sir Graham Brady, chairman of the 1922 Committee, announced on Wednesday morning that the magic number had been reached.
A ballot will be held between 6pm and 8pm in the House of Commons and the result will be announced "as soon as possible". That means it is likely to be around 9pm.
Mrs May requires a simple majority (exactly half of Tory MPs plus one voting in favour) to cling onto her position as Prime Minister. Read More Theresa May statement IN FULL: Prime Minister vows to survive vote of no confidence in leadership
If successful, her position will be safe for at least a year as another leadership challenge is forbidden for 12 months.
She will then press ahead with the aim of convincing Parliament her Brexit deal is the best available, ahead of the March 29 2019 withdrawal date. Read More
